Comment: Continuation of the Recessed Meeting of March 26, 2008

Items.MinutesNote: The Clerk (Mr. Diaz) announced the presence of a quorum.

Items.Title: Supplemental Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Supplemental Communications from City, County & Borough Offices

Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to establishing a congestion  pricing  program in the city of New York; to amend the public authorities law, in relation  to  establishing  a  metropolitan transportation  authority traffic congestion mitigation fund; to amend the tax law, in relation to eliminating an exemption from the  parking tax  for certain residents of the city of New York; to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to establishing  residential  parking systems  in the city of New York; to amend the public officers law, in relation to confidentiality of certain public records; to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a transit enhancement fund; to amend the tax law, in relation to the congestion pricing fee credit;  and  providing  for the repeal of certain provisions upon expiration thereof.” S.7243-B
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Establishing a congestion pricing program in the city of New York.

Items.Title: Supplemental Report of the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Supplemental Coupled on General Order Calendar

Items.MinutesNote: The President Pro Tempore  (Council Member Rivera) called the Meeting to order

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to consider, pursuant to a request from the Mayor, the New York  City Traffic Congestion Mitigation Implementation Plan, pursuant to Chapter 384 of the Laws of 2007.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establishing a congestion pricing program in the city of New York.

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Quinn), the Clerk of the Council adjourned to meet again on Wednesday, April 16, 2008.

HECTOR L. DIAZ, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council
The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Riovera) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.
